description: Borrowed from Latin forāmen (“aperture or opening produced by boring”), from forō (“to pierce or bore”) +‎ -men (nominal suffix).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) An opening, an orifice, or a short passage, especially in a bone.
examples: The skull contains a number of foramina through which arteries, veins, nerves, and other structures enter and exit.

Hyponyms: alar foramen, foramen cecum, foramen magnum, foramen of Magendie, foramen of Monro, foramen of Morgagni, foramen of Winslow, foramen ovale, foramen triosseum, neuroforamen, parietal foramen, sphenopalatine foramen
